class APIKey(**kwargs)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model, pulsar.mixins.single_pk.SinglePKMixin

check_key(key)¶

Validates the authenticity of an API key against its stored id.

Parameters:key (str) – The key to check against the keyhashsalt
Return type:bool
Returns:Whether or not the key matches the keyhashsalt
classmethod from_user(user_id, include_dead=False)¶

Get all API keys owned by a user.

Parameters:
  • user_id (int) – The User ID of the owner
  • include_dead (bool) – Whether or not to include dead API keys in the search
Return type:

List[APIKey]
Returns:

A list of API keys owned by the user
has_permission(permission)¶

Checks if the API key is assigned a permission. If the API key is not assigned any permissions, it checks against the user’s permissions instead.

Parameters:permission (str) – Permission to search for
Return type:bool
Returns:Whether or not the API Key has the permission
classmethod new(user_id, ip, user_agent, permissions=None)¶

Create a new API Key with randomly generated secret keys and the user details passed in as params. Generated keys are hashed and salted for storage in the database.

Parameters:
  • user_id (int) – API Key will belong to this user
  • ip (str) – The IP that this session was created with
  • user_agent (str) – User Agent the session was created with
Return type:

Tuple[str, APIKey]
Returns:

A tuple containing the identifier and the new API Key
class Invite(**kwargs)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model, pulsar.mixins.single_pk.SinglePKMixin

belongs_to_user()¶

Returns whether or not the requesting user matches the inviter.

Return type:bool
classmethod from_inviter(inviter_id, include_dead=False, used=False)¶

Get all invites sent by a user.

Parameters:
  • inviter_id (int) – The User ID of the inviter.
  • include_dead (bool) – Whether or not to include dead invites in the list
  • used (bool) – Whether or not to include used invites in the list
Return type:

List[Invite]
Returns:

A list of invites sent by the inviter
classmethod new(inviter_id, email, ip)¶

Generate a random invite code.

Parameters:
  • inviter_id (int) – User ID of the inviter
  • email (str) – E-mail to send the invite to
  • ip (int) – IP address the invite was sent from
Return type:

Invite

classmethod new(username, password, email)¶

Alternative constructor which generates a password hash and lowercases and strips leading and trailing spaces from the email.

Return type:User

class ForumPoll(**kwargs)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model, pulsar.mixins.single_pk.SinglePKMixin

can_access(permission=None, error=False)¶

Determines whether or not the requesting user can access the following resource. If no permission is specified, any user can access the resource. If a permission is specified, then access is restricted to users with that permission or “ownership” of this object. Ownership is determined with the belongs_to_user method.

Parameters:permission (Optional[str]) – Permission to restrict access to
Return type:bool
Returns:Whether or not the requesting user can access the resource

class ForumThreadSubscription(**kwargs)¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model, pulsar.mixins.multi_pk.MultiPKMixin

classmethod clear_cache_keys(user_ids=None, thread_id=None)¶

Clear the cache keys associated with specific users and/or threads. Clearing a thread cache key also clears the cache keys for all of its users

Parameters:
  • user_ids (Optional[List[int]]) – The IDs of the users whose cache keys should be cleared
  • thread_id (Optional[int]) – The ID of the thread for which the cache key should be cleared
Return type:

None
